Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <NutellaLicka - MineTheChains> How do you plan on compensating for all current hush in existence once it is an assetchain?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <NutellaLicka - MineTheChains> I'm guessing some sort of airdrop? How will this work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <hellcatz - LuckPool> <https://myhush.org/sapling/>
```
...you MUST move them to a transparent address in order to receive the airdrop. HUSH will no longer support the older version (Sprout) after the airdrop date. 
-
Snapshot height at BLOCK 500,000 (~April 14th 2019)

Funds from the current Hush chain will be snapshotted at block 500,000 and migrated to our new Sapling-enabled chain, based on Komodo. Shielded funds left in Sprout pool after block 500,000 WILL BE LOCKED on the old chain. We must manage the security of the entire coin supply with the funds of each holder. As of this writing Tue Feb 12 21:17:39 PST 2019, 1.2% of the current HUSH supply (71318.74047807 HUSH) is in INSECURE shielded Sprout addresses. 
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <NutellaLicka - MineTheChains> Maybe ill ask a more pointed question. Will the new assetchain require a premine of just over 6million coins in order to airdrop the old funds? If yes, because of the introduction of the founders reward in the new assetchain,  how will the creator stop inflating the supply, and filling the founders reward address with funds from those initial blocks, through that process?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> This is what Duke wrote earlier "the process of converting to our new chain, is quite similar to the BTCH airdrop, except now I have many tools that will make it take less time, such as using the getsnapshot RPC"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <hellcatz - LuckPool> In a general, simple answer; the existing hush supply will be "airdropped" into the new asset chain. There will be no "pre-mine" on the new chain as far as I'm aware. Only the existing hush supply will exist on the new chain and mining will resume as normal on the new chain. I'm not sure of all the details, but I'm sure more will come out as we get closer to the snapshot block around April 14th.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @NutellaLicka - MineTheChains you ask good questions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @NutellaLicka - MineTheChains the first 128 blocks of the new Hush chain with have zero block reward, in part because some of those blocks must be mined by Hush, to allow all the funds to be sent to the ~30,000 unique Hush addresses with funds. The new Hush founders reward is 10%, and 10% of 0 is 0, so there is no founders reward in the first 128 blocks (~5ish hours, but it will take  few days for our block time to normalize to 2.5mins)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Funds left in Sprout zaddrs will not be migrated to the new Hush chain, they essentially become "lost" in terms of circulating supply of the new Hush chain, but people are still free to use them, and their privacy of data stored in memo fields is retained. But their financial value will not.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> :hush_puppy: And to summarize:  :hush_puppy:  Hush total supply is staying 21M, Hush block reward is staying 12.5 with same halving schedule, Hush blocktime is staying 2.5mins. A 10% founders reward is being added, because that is what seemed reasonable to me and what the community wanted. It will allow me to focus on Hush and also pay for listing fees, server fees, domain fees and all the other things that we pay for out of pocket now. It makes Hush sustainable, instead of fighting to survive.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> All questions are welcome, I am sure there are plenty.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ËµñÁ∫¢ÂÖâ> Why not merge both chains?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Yes, the new chain will be on all exchanges we are currently on, as long as they'll do a wallet update to the new version

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> @ËµñÁ∫¢ÂÖâ, BTCH is already a "merge" of multiple chains. 

Quoting from the BTCH website:

"BTCH is not something that has ever existed before, it is not a chain split nor code fork of HUSH, 
nor ZEC, nor BTC, it is a KMD asset chain with imported UTXO dataset. 

BTCH takes the value from four different blockchains (HUSH, SUPERNET, DEX, BTC), and then dumps it onto a host chain Komodo (KMD). 
It does not fork from KMD, nor does it fork from BTC or HUSH. It is technically NOT A FORK, but a merged airdrop. "

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Good news indeed about the upcoming update to Hush. That 10% founders reward will make wonders for hushes development(server and listing funding, bounties etc. for coders). Can't wait to see what the rest of the year will have in store.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <NutellaLicka - MineTheChains> Thanks for your clarification @dukeleto How exactly will you airdrop the current hush coins into the new chain if you only mine 128 blocks to start with?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @NutellaLicka - MineTheChains to be able to send funds to addresses on the new chain, transactions must be sent, which are contained in blocks. When the new Hush chain is created, only the address corresponding to ac_pubkey has the funds. The first 128 blocks are "special" with KMD asset chains, and somethings don't happen until there are 128 blocks. Everyone can participate in mining these first 128 blocks, but they will have 0 block reward. Consider it a "bootstrapping" period, where mining pools and other nodes can migrate, before real block rewards start

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> think of it like a "fair start" for miners + pools, it gives people about 5-6hrs of migration time where downtime doesn't mean you are losing block reward

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Eddy O founders reward will go into a transparent address, 50% is allocated to fund me and 50% everything else. It will be paid out every 500 blocks.  Transparency in respect to spending the funds hasn't been discussed too much,  maybe @RunningMantheCoin or @Berg has ideas

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ËµñÁ∫¢ÂÖâ merging BTCH+HUSH would be pretty weird, since BTCH already has an old snapshot of HUSH inside of it, and it would really mess up the total supplies

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Which pools have confirmed support? I think you recommended lucky pool to me... Will they support the new chain?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Probably some kind of an voting system has to be setup in order decide how to spend the funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Eddy O we have a private room for mining pool ops with about 6 different pools in there, various other pools will probably support us that are not in there, but we have a handful that are interested in support. LuckPool will support us and is helping test the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> as a KMD asset chain, HUSH will become very easy for any KMD mining pool to add us, so we might get various new pools. Also, some old Hush pools might not upgrade. I cannot control them, but we *are* providing bounties to mining pools, to reward them for the hard work of updating their pools

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> @heguli97 I like this idea for the funds that aren't dedicated to development, but I'd have a lot of questions about how to manage that...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Especially when it comes to converting HUSH to BTC and where to peg that at
